summary.para: Represents an item in a singly linked list.

remarks.para: All list items must be aligned on a MEMORY_ALLOCATION_ALIGNMENT boundary. Unaligned items can cause unpredictable results. See _aligned_malloc.
For an example, see Using Singly Linked Lists.

summary.para: A pointer to an SLIST_ENTRY structure that represents the next item in a singly linked list.
Represents an item in a singly linked list.

remarks.para: All list items must be aligned on a MEMORY_ALLOCATION_ALIGNMENT boundary. Unaligned items can cause unpredictable results. See _aligned_malloc.
For an example, see Using Singly Linked Lists.

summary.para: A pointer to an SLIST_ENTRY structure that represents the next item in a singly linked list.
